intro: Mecopus nidulans, commonly known as the common meadow cranesbill, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and distinctive, doubly serrated leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink or red flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Mecopus nidulans is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also an important nectar source for pollinators.
